subject: Handling HTTP range requests in Glance

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Comments inline

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This really needs a better explanation. This patch turns the download function into a nightmare. Is there really no way to keep something simple? It seems to me that we already return the right data when asked for a "range request", and that our main issue is the "Content-Length" header.
Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Patch Set 1:

Hi Cyril.
We do return the correct data for the requested range.
But, the following does not happen:
1. Fail with 416, if range is not satisfiable
2. Set Content-Range to the satisfied 'range' of the partial content requested.
3. Set Content-Length to the size of the partial content.
I was trying to accommodate these along with just returning a "206" for a satisfiable range. 
Please advise if there is a simpler way to add these with the existing functionality.

Patch Set 1:

Hey! Thanks for the explanations. I agree with 1). I'm not sure about 2): where exactly do we set Content-Range ?


About 3), I feel like we should be able to just compute the Content-Length. That is what I tried to do at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/367370/1 . We know the offset and the requested size, we could compute the length, and decide whether the request can be fulfilled. Having the for loop and the flag is quite confusing imho.

So, long story short: would it be possible to remove the loop, and compute everything rather than relying on trial & error?

Patch Set 1:

Cyril, the loop is used to find the nearest satisfiable range to the one that was requested. It should work as implemented, but I agree with you, it adds complexity that is not strictly necessary. I would also recommend removing the loop and only return 206 if the exact range can be satisfied, with the proper content length, otherwise return 416.

Patch Set 1:

Thank you Cyrill and Alex.
I had added the loop to determine the satisfiable range and return the image until that satisfiable range. 
If we do not wish to provide that functionality yet, I will remove the loop and just return a 416.

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

OK, I like this better. I really disagreed with "trying to do the best thing possible if the range the user asked is wrong". When the user is wrong, they should be told they are wrong, that is what is best for them (and for us:p).

I still have some concerns, though.

Hi Nikhil,
Posting question inline.

Patch Set 6:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi Nikhil,
 > Posting question inline.

 	
Dharini, good questions. keep up the good work!

I think you'd file a lite-spec explaining the need for those changes and we can debate on the design proposal rather than you having to work your way through the code and then get stuck with differing opinions.

BTW, whatever challenges exist for range parsing, I think we need to implement that in Glance rather than a incorrect header which will make the API inconsistent.

Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

Setting -workflow and submitting a lite-spec regarding a potential shift to the usage of "Range" header's parser as per comments on  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/367528/6/glance/common/wsgi.py.
Wil get back to work on this based on the opinion obtained.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/375123/
